results.title: Sunshine man : Changes face of farming
results.brief_description: Examines the development of the Sunshine Harvester by Hugh McKay, and the landmark industrial relations conflict in which he subsequently became involved, leading to the first Basic Wage ruling (1907).

results.title: Sunshine and shadows: seventy years of Australian cinema
results.creator_credit: Australian Broadcasting Commission and Brian Adams
results.brief_description: Jack Thompson examines the evolution of Australian cinema from the isolated production of “The True Story of the Kelly Gang” in 1906 to the increasingly confident films of the 1970s. Seventy years of triumph, heartbreak, frustration, hopes, fears and success. With the aid of film clips, this documentary also looks at various themes and attitudes expressed in the films of this period. Written by David Stratten. Suitable for middle and upper secondary levels.

results.title: Sunshine and shadow [NTSC]
results.creator_credit: Ric Burns, Lisa Ades, New York Historical Society, WNET (Television station : New York, N.Y.), Thirteen, WGBH (Boston) and Steeplechase Films
results.brief_description:
Episode number 3 of Series “New York: a documentary film”.
Episode 3: SUNSHINE AND SHADOW (1865-1898) charts New York’s history during the decades following the Civil War when it continued to grow demographically, geographically and financially at a staggering rate. It explores the incomparable fortunes of the robber barons at the unabashed corruption of political leaders in an era when the expansion of both wealth and poverty- and the schism between them- built to a complex. The episode ends with the consolidation of the five boroughs to form Greater New York on January 1, 1898. Narrated by David Ogden Stiers.

results.title: Sunset country
results.creator_credit: State Film Centre of Victoria and David Corke
results.brief_description: A record of an expedition of 12 people who crossed a little-known area of the Victorian Mallee known as the Sunset Country to find out more about the wild life that lives there. Members of the party included C. Austin, R. Boswell, D.G. Corke, D. Holland, M.A. Howard, F.E. Lobb, A.R. McEvey, E. Molesworth, G.M. Pizzey, H.M. Ross, H.N.B. Wettenhall. Commentary by Graham Lynden.

results.title: Sunrise: awakening = Tjintu-pakani (A) (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Andre Reese and Australia Council. Aboriginal Arts Board
results.brief_description: Depicts a six-week long Aboriginal theatre workshop at the Black Theatre Arts and Culture Centre in Redfern, Sydney that culminates in a first performance for most of the participants. Highlights the dignity and growing self-image of those who participated. Suitable for secondary level. Performers include Andrew Jackomos.

results.title: Sunrise, Sunset: Moni and George
results.creator_credit: Healthsharing Women. Publishing and Production Group and Chris O'Rourke
results.brief_description: Some of the changes occurring in Australia in Australian industry. are examined in this programme. The episode looks at what has been the success of such changes. Moni, a bank employee, and George, an airport services co-ordinator, give their points of view.

results.title: Sunrise sunset
results.creator_credit: Victoria. Ministry of Education and Chris O'Rourke
results.brief_description: This program shows some of the changes currently occurring in local industries, tracing the development of the robot industry and the implications this has had for production costs and changes in job direction. Particular emphasis is on the importance of research and development - ideas and innovations.

results.title: Sunrise profession: land degradation hypothetical
results.creator_credit: John Nicholson, La Trobe University and John Nairn
results.brief_description: Part 1. An introduction to the School of Agriculture courses at La Trobe University, highlighting hi-tech science, state of the art facilities, applied problem solving, global issues, real world economics, innovative teaching and breakthough research. Part 2. An agricultural hypothetical teaching exercise on land degradation dealing with the salinity problems in northern Victoria.

results.title: Sunrise over Tiananmen Square
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Donald McWilliams, Barrie Angus McLean and Shui-Bo Wang
results.brief_description: Shui-Bo Wang offers a personal perspective on the Cultural Revolution in China through the form of an artist’s visual autobiography in this part documentary, part animated narrative. A Red Guard in his youth, Wang grew up in the years of the Cultural Revolution and beyond, a life’s journey that saw him serving in the military as a propaganda artist for the cause of a society based on equality and cooperation until he became an artist and then teacher in the 1980s and witnessed the protests which changed the symbolism of Tiananmen Square for years to come. A powerful statement on an individual, and a generation, grappling with the idealism and intolerance of a revolutionary society this artist’s testimony traces this period in China’s history through a combination of original artwork, family and archival photographs as well as animation and documentary footage.

results.title: Sunrise over South Africa
results.creator_credit: Greg Grainger, Grainger Maynard, Maynard and Seven Network Limited (Australia)
results.brief_description: A description of the people, wildlife, political climate and tourist attractions of post-apartheid (1992) South Africa. Covering the whole spectrum of life in this highly controversial country, this video ends with a message of great hope from a myriad of people of all races.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Greg Grainger, Grainger Maynard, Maynard and Seven Network Limited (Australia)
